title.narrative: DFAT Direct Aid Program : Project Strengthening of Free Time Activities Rooms -ATL Kindergarten of Mulundo Quarter (15A492)

description.narrative: The Direct Aid Program (DAP) is a small grants scheme administered by the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) through Australia's diplomatic posts in developing partner countries. The DAP's objective is to deliver targeted local level assistance. The total value of this multi-country initiative is $22 million expensed over the 2015-16 financial year. This project aims to equip the Centre for Socio Mulundo, one of the social facilities of ARCAR- Association for Rehabilitation of Abandoned Children and at Risk of essential materials such as swing, tables and chairs respective, mattresses, pots, pans, ladles, sleepers, coffee makers, dishes, cups, forks, knives, spoons, shelves, refrigerator, ark, microwave and electric oven and even better performance the implementation of educational activities, cultural and leisure that are developed in this center.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
